| rev1 = Allmusic rev1Score = [ Allmusic]
}}

'Play' is a 1991 album by the British New Wave group Squeeze. It is the band's
ninth album, and their only released by Reprise Records. It is the first LP in
the Squeeze discography to feature only four official members instead of five
(Steve Nieve took on many of the keyboard duties that would have gone to Jools
Holland in the past). Tony Berg produced the album. In the liner notes to the
1996 Squeeze compilation [[Excess Moderation]], Glenn Tilbrook stated that he
considers Play the beginning of Squeeze's "renaissance period."

The liner notes to the album are, appropriately, in the form of a play that
incorporates the lyrics of the songs in a script that also references the plays
[[Our Town]] by Thornton Wilder and [[Waiting for Godot]] by Samuel Beckett.
